p: This is reflected in the detection of five laboratory confirmed, mosquito-borne, autochthonous human WNV cases in 2019. It has to be kept in mind that less than 25% of infected humans develop noticeable symptoms [ 3]. Even fewer patients (<1%) have a risk of developing WNND [ 4]. The number of observed WNND cases (three of the five confirmed human WNV) gives rise to the speculation that hundreds of undetected human WNV infections in Germany occurred during the epidemic in 2019.
